title: Google Photos is testing a faster way to reach your on-device folders
summary: A new dedicated shortcut will save you from digging through the Collections menu to find your on-device folders and media.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Google is testing a new â€œfolderâ€ icon in the main header to provide instant access to on-device media. The Collections tab may receive a visual refresh featuring color-filled buttons for top shortcuts. Google is hard at work making Google Photos better than ever. Weâ€™ve spotted the company working on a date label toggle for a more immersive Photos tab and on additional customization options for collages . There are more changes to uncover, namely a new shortcut for on-device folders and UI changes for the Collections tab. title: Google Photos wants to become your go-to app for making collages
summary: So it's testing new editing features that should been here already.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google is testing new editing options within the Collage Editor inside Google Photos. The changes include new settings to customize the frameâ€™s thickness, curvature, and color. It also organizes the editorâ€™s options using a cleaner interface. I donâ€™t know about you, but for me, Google Photos is the closest thing to a digital time capsule . Iâ€™ve used it to back up my photos longer than any social media app has, and I expect to do so until Google lets the app live. Besides automatically generated memories, you can also revisit memories by creating collages within the Photos app. But if you use the built-in Collage Editor in Photos, you might find it limiting compared to other third-party apps. Thankfully, Google is now testing new features that let you tweak collages to your taste and keep you from having to look for alternatives . title: This 7-inch gaming handheld just made its unique controller modules free for a limited time
summary: An already sweet deal just got even sweeter, but only for early buyers.
body: Credit: YouTube TL;DR A few hours from release, MANGMI has added free microswitch modules for early buyers of the Pocket Max handheld. The device features a 7-inch OLED screen, Snapdragon 865, and swappable control modules. Super Early Bird pricing is $199, but it faces stiff competition from the AYN Odin 2 Portal. MANGMI is less than a day away from launching the cheapest 7-inch gaming handheld on the market, the Pocket Max , but the deal just became a little sweeter. Today, the company announced that all Super Early Bird orders will also include a free set of microswitch modules. The modular nature of the MANGMI Pocket Max is one of its most unique and confusing features. The device includes a set of soft membrane modules for the D-pad and buttons in the box, with additional clicky microswitch modules sold separately for $15 (previously $12). The modules canâ€™t be moved to, say, put the D-pad above the sticks, but some gamers are very picky about their inputs.

title: Abbey Road Studios to Hold First-Ever Rave withÂ Soulwax
summary: The event will also mark the first major showcase of the DEEWEE Soundsystem.
body: In a move that is set to redefine what can happen inside one of musicâ€™s most historic rooms, Abbey Road Studios will host its first-ever rave. Related Abbey Road Boss Sally Davies on Studio One’s Massive Revamp and ‘Turbo-Charging’ Its Next Decade Miss Piggy Addresses Whether She & Sabrina Carpenter Have 'Made Up' After Concert Arrest A$AP Rocky Returns to Harlem & Teaches 4th Grade Kids How to Rap: 'Rap Is My Life' Studio One will team up with Belgian electronic innovators Soulwax for a one-off event titled Abbey Road After Hours , taking place on Feb. 21 from 8 p.m. to 1 a.m. The north west London studio will welcome 300 attendees for what Abbey Road describes as â€œa world-first experience.â€ Admission will be free via a public ballot, which is now open. Fans can enter by calling the ‘Soulwax rave hotline’ at +447886 072699. Soulwax â€“ brothers David and Stephen Dewaele â€“ were invited by Abbey Road to curate the night. Programming will include DJ sets from their long-running alter ego 2manydjs, along with special guests yet to be announced. The event will also mark the first major showcase of the DEEWEE Soundsystem, a câ€¦

title: Listening to Bad Bunny for the first time? Hereâ€™s how to translate his song lyrics on Spotify
summary: The new Spotify feature arrives in time for you to learn what the Grammy-winning artist will be singing about on Sunday.
body: Credit: Matt Horne / Android Authority The Super Bowl LX halftime show on Sunday is shaping up to be a genuine pop-culture moment, even if you couldnâ€™t care less about the game itself. This yearâ€™s headline act is Bad Bunny, making him the first solo Latin artist to lead the prestigious halftime show. If youâ€™ve somehow avoided his music until now, Sunday night might just change that. The Puerto Rican singer is heading into the halftime show on a serious high. He recently picked up Album of the Year at the Grammys for DebÃ­ Tirar MÃ¡s Fotos, becoming the first Spanish-language artist to win the award, and his music has been everywhere in the run-up to the game. With tens of millions of viewers expected to tune in to Super Bowl LX, a lot of people are about to hear his songs for the first time.

title: Change my mind: Most people should buy last-gen phones
summary: For multiple reasons.
body: Credit: Mishaal Rahman / Android Authority I know you want that shiny new phone your favorite brand just launched, but donâ€™t let your emotions get the best of you. Buying last yearâ€™s model is the better choice for multiple reasons. And this doesnâ€™t just apply to high-end phones, but also to the more affordable models from the Pixel A and Samsung Galaxy A lineups. And just to be clear, Iâ€™m not talking about buying a used device from a stranger on the internet. Iâ€™m talking about buying a brand-new, sealed unit of a phone that was launched about a year ago. Hereâ€™s why I believe that makes sense for most people.

title: 6 big changes coming to your Pixel in next monthâ€™s Android 16 QPR3 update
summary: March is going to be a lot of fun for Pixel users.
body: Android 16 QPR3 â€” Googleâ€™s next big Pixel update â€” is right around the corner. QPR (Quarterly Platform Release) updates have become significant milestones for Pixel phones , as they typically include many user-facing changes, particularly compared to smaller monthly security updates. Google is expected to release its QPR3 update in March, meaning weâ€™re just a month away from your Pixel getting a big revamp. But what exactly is new? What are the biggest features and changes you should be on the lookout for? Iâ€™ve been using the latest Android 16 QPR3 beta to find out.

title: Google Photos could soon let you choose a cleaner look for your library, and hereâ€™s your first look
summary: New toggle will allow users to hide date labels for a sleek, immersive gallery experience.
body: Credit: Adamya Sharma / Android Authority TL;DR Google Photos is testing a toggle to hide date labels in the primary gallery view for a more immersive look. Hiding date labels also removes the batch-selection checkmark, though users can still select dates via a scrolling pill. A few weeks ago, we showed off Google Photos working on a Playback speed option for videos , as well as testing the ability to hide date labels for a more immersive Photos view. At the time, we couldnâ€™t get the date labels to actually hide and the immersive Photos view to surface. With the latest Google Photos v7.62.0.865122296 update, we can finally show off how Google Photos would look with date labels hidden. title: This is the best Android keyboard app, as decided by our readers
summary: Poll numbers point to a clear winner, but reader comments suggest it's a close race.
body: Android fans have several heated debates going at any given time, and one of them is usually about which Android keyboard is best. In a recent article, I detailed my experience of switching from Gboard to Microsoftâ€™s SwiftKey . After using it for several days, I discovered that the grass isnâ€™t always greener on Googleâ€™s side of the fence. I rather liked the enhanced customization options the keyboard offered me, but I also wanted to gather broader opinions from our community. I conducted a poll asking readers to vote for their preferred Android keyboard app. So, which piece of software won?

title: Galaxy S26 series pricing leaks, and thereâ€™s good news and bad news

title: Thereâ€™s at least one reason to choose the Exynos Galaxy S26 over the Snapdragon version, for now
summary: Alas, you don't get to choose which variant your region gets.
body: Galaxy S26 Pro render Credit: Android Headlines TL;DR The Exynos-powered Galaxy S26 might feature better on-device AI with native image generation capabilities. Samsung is reportedly collaborating with another company to bring a lightweight version of Stable Diffusion for on-device image generation. The feature is expected to be called EdgeFusion and could generate 512-pixel images in â€œa few seconds.â€ AI has now mutated into an integral part of our devices. But brands still use a hybrid AI arrangement, where only part of the processing occurs locally, with most of the lifting done by AI models in cloud infrastructure. On-device AI on phones, for instance, has largely been limited to processing text, while richer media, such as images, are processed online. As expected, the latter approach raises privacy concerns, but Samsung could take a step toward addressing them by bringing on-device image generation to the upcoming Galaxy S26 . According to the information received by the Korean news outlet Seoul Economic Daily , Samsungâ€™s Exynos 2600 chipset will be capable of running text-to-image generation AI models without the internet on the Galaxy S26. The feature is likely to be calledâ€¦

title: Ahead of U.S. Concerts, Hatchie Rides on WithÂ â€˜Carouselâ€™
summary: On the eve of another United States run, the Australian dream-pop practitioner drops â€œCarousel,â€ the latest single from her third studio album "Liquorice."
body: Hatchie is strapped into the Carousel . On the eve of another United States run, and the announcement of new shows closer to home, the Australian dream-pop practitioner drops â€œCarousel,â€ the latest single from her third studio album Liquorice . â€œCarouselâ€ explores themes of fixation, longing and emotional suspension, all of it dripping in shoegaze and swirling guitars, building to an epic chorus. It’s almost thick enough to touch. Stream it below. Hatchie is the project of Melbourne-based, Brisbane-raised singer-songwriter Harriette Pilbeam. And she has come out firing in the New Year. In support of Liquorice , she plays the Lodge Room this evening, Feb. 5, in Los Angeles, followed by a show Feb. 20 at New Yorkâ€™s Music Hall of Williamsburg. Then, she’ll return to Sydney for a headline show May 3 at The Vanguard, as part of The Great Southern Nights 2026 , a weeks-long lineup across New South Wales featuring Paul Kelly, Missy Higgins, Thelma Plum, Jet, 3% and many others. As previously reported , Hatchie features on the new Yo Gabba GabbaLand! Season 2 soundtrack, alongside Santigold, CHVRCHES, Ziggy Marley and Sharon Van Etten, with her original cut â€œ Movin’ My Bâ€¦

title: The Galaxy S26 series might not offer the Pixel 10â€™s biggest upgrade after all
summary: Hoping for a Samsung take on Google's PixelSnap? There's some bad news.
body: Credit: Android Headlines TL;DR A leaker has claimed that the Galaxy S26 Ultra wonâ€™t have integrated magnets after all. This contradicts previous leaks, which pointed to built-in Qi2 magnets. Instead, Galaxy S26 Ultra owners will have to buy cases with magnets in them. Weâ€™ve heard rumors for a while now that the Samsung Galaxy S26 series could offer integrated magnets. This would enable support for magnetically attached accessories and Qi2 MPP chargers. Unfortunately, a prominent leaker has some bad news. Tipster Ice Universe has claimed on Twitter that the Galaxy S26 Ultra wonâ€™t offer built-in magnets, citing â€œindependent sources.â€ Instead, youâ€™ll need to buy a magnetic case to make use of magnetically attached peripherals.

title: Milano Cortina 2026
summary: About 2,900 Olympic athletes have converged on northern Italy to sort out who is the GOATâ€”or perhaps the stoat.
body: Earth Observatory Science Earth Observatory Milano Cortinaâ€¦ Earth Earth Observatory Image of the Day EO Explorer Topics All Topics Atmosphere Land Heat & Radiation Life on Earth Human Dimensions Natural Events Oceans Remote Sensing Technology Snow & Ice Water More Content Collections Global Maps World of Change Articles Notes from the Field Blog Earth Matters Blog Blue Marble: Next Generation EO Kids Mission: Biomes About About Us Subscribe ðŸ›œ RSS Contact Us Search December 8, 2025 No Olympic competitions covers more ground than the 50-kilometer cross-country ski races . The grueling event takes more than 2 hours to complete, requiring competitors to ski a distance longer than a marathon. Thatâ€™s still, however, less than an eighth of the distance between the two official host cities of the 2026 Winter Olympics and Paralympics â€”Milan and Cortina dâ€™Ampezzo. With events spread across more than 22,000 square kilometers (8,500 square miles) and eight cities or towns in northern Italy, these are the most geographically dispersed Games in Olympic history. The decentralized design was intentional, allowing planners to control costs and make the event more sustainable by using exâ€¦

title: Melanie Martinez Sets Fourth Studio AlbumÂ â€˜HADESâ€™
summary: The alt-pop phenom is taking us on a trip to 'HADES,' her fourth studio album that's set to drop March 27.
body: Next stop, HADES. After sharing the new single â€œPOSSESSION,â€ her first new music in three years , Melanie Martinez is taking us on a trip to HADES , her fourth studio album that’s set to drop March 27. â€œEach song on this record explores a different trap set by the kind of evil, patriarchal energy that is HADES . It isnâ€™t about predicting a dystopian future,â€ she explains in a statement announcing the new collection. “Itâ€™s about recognizing destructive patterns that already exist. The same dynamics repeating in different places. Control disguised as protection. Cruelty framed as logic. Exploitation sold as opportunity. Once you start noticing those threads, it becomes hard to ignore them.â€ HADES is an appropriately hot theme for this alt-pop phenom. Following its release last month, â€œPOSSESSIONâ€ was by some distance the favorite new cut of the week, as chosen by readers of Billboard.com . Also, the track debuted with more than 2.7 million Spotify streams in its first 24 hours and has surpassed 10 million to date, according to reps at Warner Music. Itâ€™s now Martinezâ€™s fastest-streaming release and the biggest female debut of 2026. HADES is the followup to 2023â€™s Portals â€¦

title: Barry Manilow Postpones Las Vegas Residency Following CancerÂ Surgery
summary: The pop veteran was initially booked for residency dates at Westgate Las Vegas later this month, but has scrapped those plans on his â€œdoctorâ€™s guidance and recommendation.â€
body: Barry Manilow is fit and fine after surgery, but heâ€™s pushing back his upcoming concert dates in Las Vegas to focus on the road ahead. The pop veteran was initially booked for residency dates at Westgate Las Vegas, from Feb. 12-21, but has scrapped those plans on his â€œdoctorâ€™s guidance and recommendation,â€ he writes in a social post. The Grammy winner recently went under the knife after a scan revealed stage one lung cancer. The operation was deemed a success, but he needs more time out. â€œIâ€™m doing great and recovering very well after my surgery,â€ he writes. â€œIâ€™ve been getting exercise and spending some time in the studio, which has been fantastic.â€ With some additional downtime, he continues, â€œI can stay focused on healing and getting ready for the tour thatâ€™s kicking off at the end of February. Having a few extra weeks to rest and prepare is what the doctor ordered!â€ View this post on Instagram No replacement dates have been announced for the postponed Vegas shows, and tickets will be refunded at the point of purchase, reps say. Manilow will return to the Westgate on March 26, 27 and 28, part of a national swing that starts Feb. 27 at Benchmark International Arena in Tampa, FL. â€¦

title: Donâ€™t You Sweat It, Baby: Taylor Swift â€˜Opaliteâ€™ Music Video Is On theÂ Way
summary: The Life of a Showgirl continues with a second music video, following lead single "The Fate of Ophelia."
body: Four months after the release of The Life of a Showgirl , Taylor Swift has announced a second music video from the project: The “Opalite” music video will arrive on Spotify and Apple Music on Friday morning (Feb. 6). The pop star made the announcement on her website , unveiling a countdown clock to 8 a.m. ET on Friday morning. Following the Apple and Spotify premiere, the music video will be available Sunday (Feb. 8) on YouTube. Fans will have to wait and see whether the “Opalite” video is the same as the version that was shown during the album&#8217â€¦

title: Camâ€™ron Elaborates on Why Heâ€™s Suing J. Cole: â€˜Being a Man Is Keeping YourÂ Wordâ€™
summary: The Harlem rapper didn't appreciate being given the runaround when it was time for him to cash in his favor in return.
body: Cam’ron recently elaborated on why he decided to file a lawsuit against J. Cole over their “Ready ’24” collab on an episode of Talk With Flee . The Harlem rapper explained that he filed the lawsuit to get the Carolina rapper’s attention after being given the runaround when he needed the favor returned of either a feature or an interview on one of his talk shows. Related A Timeline of Jim Jones & Cam’ron’s Never-Ending Feud Cam’ron & Mase Compare Coverage of Cardi B & Stefon Diggs’ Romance Versus Taylor Swift & Travis Kelce: ‘It’s Culture’ R&B/Hip-Hop Fresh Picks of the Week: Cam’ron, Trim, DaBaby, 42 Dugg, Samm Henshaw & More “I never ever wanted to do anything as far as a lawsuit was concerned,” he began. “This is exactly what happened, just so you know, and I don’t really care anymore; it was just more to get his attention. Not saying that I don’t need to be compensated for what I do or do what you say you’re gonna do. And to me, being a man is keeping your word, and I know everybody’s busy and has things to do and so on and so fortâ€¦

title: Remember Xiaomiâ€™s modular camera concept? It might actually happen this year
summary: Tipster offers hope that Xiaomi's moving forward with production.
body: TL;DR Last year at MWC, Xiaomi previewed its Modular Optical System. The system would allow phone users to attach external camera hardware for high-quality shots. Now a tipster is sharing a vague hint that might point to a possible commercial release. Cameras need space. Manufacturers have done an utterly remarkable job creating some incredibly compact lens-and-sensor assemblies â€” so much so that for the vast majority of us, our phones are now our primary cameras â€” but when you really want to go above and beyond with features and image quality, that means growing past the confines of our phones. One way a number of brands have been doing that is through add-on lenses , but last last year, one phone company teased an even more impressive add-on â€” and it could soon be ready to make its commercial debut. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Anker SOLIXâ€™s new power backup system merges renewable and fossil fuel power for the best results
summary: Three SOLIX E10s can be joined together for a total 90kW output.
body: Credit: Anker SOLIX TL;DR Anker SOLIX has opened sales of its latest hybrid home power backup solution, the E10. In addition to solar and battery-based backup, the SOLIX E10 also supports a fuel-based Smart Generator that can run on gasoline, natural gas, or propane. The multiple systems can offer a combined power output of 90kW. As part of its CES 2026 showcase, Ankerâ€™s sub-brand SOLIX gave us a preview of its new integrated home backup solution, the SOLIX E10. Following that early look last month, nationwide sales of the E10 platform are opening today. SOLIX says the E10 is the worldâ€™s first â€œsmart hybrid whole home backup system.â€ While the other bits are self-explanatory, hybrid here refers to its ability to run on multiple fuel options. In addition to its support for solar power and a battery-based backup solution , the E10 also supports traditional fuels such as propane, gasoline, and natural gas through the SOLIX Smart Generator 5500, which can be effective in scenarios with prolonged outages and scant sunlight.

title: YouTube auto-dub translations just got a whole lot better
summary: The powerful language tool is getting a huge expansion.
body: TL;DR YouTube just announced some big access and feature expansions to video auto-dubbing. Auto dubbing is now generally available to creators, and Expressive Speech debuts with support for eight languages. YouTube has also started its pilot program to test lip sync for translations. YouTube attracts creators from all around the world, and while that means thereâ€™s almost always going to be some great new content out there thatâ€™s targeted at you, it sucks when the video you most want to watch isnâ€™t available in your language. Googleâ€™s been working hard for years to break down those kind of barriers, though, most recently introducing automatic dubbing into multiple languages. This week, weâ€™re learning about what sounds like the programâ€™s biggest and most impactful expansion since its creation. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Google Meetâ€™s universal translator looks like itâ€™s getting ready to go mobile (Update: Confirmed)
summary: Meet's best new tool could finally make the jump to phones.
body: TL;DR Google Meet supports real-time speech translation for select languages, but only on computers. Now the Meet Android app shows what could be early evidence for adding the same kind of speech translation. Itâ€™s not yet clear if this would be limited to certain devices, or if an AI subscription would still be required. Update, February 4, 2026 (10:42 AM ET): We might have let the cat out of the bag a little early, but today Google is going official with its plans to bring Meet speech translation to mobile devices: â€œSpeech translation will roll out to the Meet Android and iOS apps in the coming months.â€

title: January 2026 Google Play system update just turned into November 2025? Youâ€™re not alone
summary: Users report a bizarre glitch that reverts their Android devices from the January patch to an older 2025 update.
body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority TL;DR Users are reporting that the latest Google Play system update reverts their version from January 2026 to November 2025. Reports are largely from Google Pixel users, but the issue affects phones from other Android brands too. The â€œdowngradeâ€ may be a mislabeled February 2026 update, and users are advised to stay on the latest available version for now. Google Play System Updates (GPSU) allow Google to deliver modular components of the Android OS directly to your phone, bypassing the usual manufacturer and carrier delays. The system isnâ€™t perfect, though, as manufacturers like S amsung have had delays that they eventually rectified . Users are now reporting more weirdness around Google Play System Updates, as it seems the newest update is downgrading users from the January 2026 GPSU to the November 2025 GPSU. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Google is testing a cleaner Gemini overlay at the cost of some of its best features
summary: A future update may bury one-tap actions like "Ask about place" and screen sharing inside the overlay's Plus menu.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Google is experimenting with moving contextual actions like â€œAsk about placeâ€ and â€œAsk about PDFâ€ into the Plus menu in the Gemini overlay. Google could also move the â€œShare conversationâ€ button to the top-right corner of the main conversation UI for easier access. In the latest Google app v17.4.66 release, weâ€™ve spotted a bunch of new Gemini features under development. There are more clues about Geminiâ€™s agentic abilities for Android phones , a new Map area button in the attachment sheet, and a new â€œCharactersâ€ feature . Thatâ€™s not all, though, as weâ€™ve also spotted code for a couple of UI tweaks, which weâ€™ve managed to activate to give you an early look. title: The Galaxy S25 FE might be Samsungâ€™s best-kept secret

However, colleague Andrew Grush recently got his daughter a Galaxy S25 FE and subsequently wondered why he bothered with flagships. Between this article and my own time with the phone last year, I realized that the Galaxy S25 FE is actually Samsungâ€™s best-kept secret today.

title: JellyFin is the best Plex alternative, and itâ€™s finally expanding to more TVs
summary: There's bad news if you have an old Samsung TV, though.
body: TL;DR The popular JellyFin app is now available on Samsung Tizen TVs. This Plex alternative allows you to watch content over a local network. JellyFin for Tizen is only available for recent Samsung TVs running Tizen 6.0 or higher. Plex is the most popular app for watching stored content over a local network, but JellyFin has also emerged as a great alternative over the years. JellyFin isnâ€™t available on Samsung TVs, though, but weâ€™ve finally got some good news. A user on JellyFinâ€™s GitHub repository (h/t: Linuxiac and XDA-Developers ) noticed that the media server app was now available on the Tizen app store for Samsung TVs. Another user followed up by posting a photo of JellyFin installed on their Samsung TV, as seen below.

body: TL;DR Samsung has just posted three teaser videos for the Galaxy S26 phones. The first teaser video suggests that we should expect better long-range camera zoom. The other two clips point to better low-light video capture. Samsung has started teasing the arrival of the Galaxy S26 series , and the phones are tipped to launch on February 25. Now, the Korean giant has posted three teaser videos for the new phones. The first video, seen above, shows someone zooming in on a pet dog well beyond 5x or 10x. This obviously hints at improved camera zoom. However, the fine print also notes that this simulated picture has an AI-generated background.

We are living in what feels like a dangerous time to be a smartphone company, with manufacturers either closing up shop , backing away from flagships , or denying reports of business trouble . Itâ€™s almost enough to make you think there wonâ€™t be anyone left but Samsung and Apple before you know it. title: This may be when Google plans to phase out Chrome OS
summary: Aluminium OS may not be ready for a couple more years.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority TL;DR Court documents in Googleâ€™s search antitrust case reveal that Aluminium OS may not be ready for a full release until 2028. The new operating system could be offered to â€œcommercial trusted testersâ€ in late 2026 before its full release. Google reportedly plans to phase out Chrome OS in 2034. Google will soon challenge Windows and Mac with a new PC operating system, called Aluminium OS , that combines Android and Chrome OS. The Mountain View-based firm officially announced the new OS last September during Qualcommâ€™s Snapdragon Summit. You may be wondering, â€œHow soon is soon?â€ Based on court documents, it appears we may have to wait a couple more years. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Dude, whereâ€™s my car? Android Auto users report vanishing icon bug
summary: Some Android Auto users say their car icon keeps disappearing when navigating with Google Maps.
body: TL;DR Some Android Auto users report Google Maps losing the car icon when switching back to split-screen mode. Navigation still works, but the car marker disappears until Maps is force-closed on the phone. Several users say switching back to the default blue arrow icon may stop the issue, at least for now. Like many people, I like to replace the blue arrow with a car avatar when navigating with Google Maps. Itâ€™s just a bit of fun customization because you donâ€™t really need any icon at all â€” you know that your position is anchored at the bottom-center of the navigation screen. Still, itâ€™s familiar to have my position marked in this fun way, so I can imagine it must have been strange for some users who have recently seen the car icon vanish completely when using Google Maps on Android Auto . The issue popped up in a recent Reddit thread on r/AndroidAuto , where one user described a repeatable bug: if the media player is in full-screen and they switch back to split view, the car icon simply disappears. Navigation still works, but thereâ€™s no visual indicator of the carâ€™s actual location. Force-quitting Maps on the phone brings the icon back for the user, but only until the next time iâ€¦

title: Google is finally fixing one of Pixelâ€™s biggest connectivity headaches in Android 16
summary: Google finally gives Pixel users granular control over Adaptive Connectivity in Android 16.
body: Image of a Pixel phone with Androidâ€™s Quick Settings on it. Original photo by Joe Maring. Gemini Nano Banana Pro was used to modify the photo and place the screenshot on the screen. TL;DR Google is updating Pixelâ€™s vague Adaptive Connectivity with clearer controls in Android 16 QPR3 Beta 2. Thereâ€™s a new â€œAuto-switch to mobile networkâ€ toggle that keeps you online when Wi-Fi is weak, but may use more data. The â€œOptimize network for battery lifeâ€ toggle prioritizes efficiency to help extend battery life. Finding the right balance between a strong connection and a battery that lasts all day has always been tricky for smartphones. For years, Googleâ€™s Adaptive Connectivity was a simple switch that worked in the background, but it didnâ€™t explain what it was doing. Now, with the latest Android 16 QPR3 Beta 2 update, Pixel phones are getting a more detailed version of that feature. The main change is that instead of a single on/off switch for Adaptive Connectivity, there are now two separate toggles, each with its own purpose. Both are turned on by default, as a Reddit user noticed (via 9to5Google ).

title: Samsung thinks you all want more Folds than Flips in 2026
summary: Samsung's foldable phone production plans might be unprecedented for the Galaxy maker.
body: Credit: Hadlee Simons / Android Authority TL;DR Samsung reportedly plans to produce more Galaxy Z Fold 8 units than Galaxy Z Flip 8 devices this year. This would be the first time that Samsung plans to produce more Folds than Flips from the outset. This comes after the Galaxy Z Fold 7 reportedly outsold the Galaxy Z Flip 8 last year, despite Samsung originally planning to make more Flips. Samsung traditionally produces more Flip phones than Fold devices in a given year, as Flip foldables are significantly cheaper and tend to see more demand. However, it sounds like Samsung is planning to flip (heh) the script in 2026. Korean outlet ET News reports that Samsung plans to produce more Galaxy Z Fold 8 units than Galaxy Z Flip 8 devices this year. The website, citing industry sources, says Samsung will make 3.5 million Galaxy Z Fold 8 devices in 2026 versus 2.5 to 3 million Z Flip 8 units.

title: With Galaxy Buds 4, Samsung wants to avoid its past mistakes at all costs
summary: Galaxy Buds 4 will focus on practicality and a "stable" design.
body: Credit: AssembleDebug / Android Authority TL;DR Samsung is rumored to launch the Galaxy Buds 4 and Buds 4 Pro alongside the Galaxy S26 later this month. The earbuds are likely to feature a practical, stable design to avoid the Galaxy Buds 3â€™s quality issues. The Buds 4 series might also cost the same as the Buds 3 did at launch. Unlike its smartphones, Samsung refreshes its flagship earbuds once every two years. That means the successor to the Galaxy Buds 3 series should launch sometime this year. While Samsung typically launches earbuds alongside its foldables at mid-year, it may release the Buds 4 and Buds 4 Pro earlier than usual, alongside the Galaxy S26 series later this month. And, the chief focus for these flagship earbuds would be reliability. According to industry sources cited by Koreaâ€™s ET News , Samsungâ€™s efforts with the upcoming Galaxy Buds 4 series aim to regain consumer trust. The Galaxy Buds 3â€™s launch was marred by widespread reliability issues, including poor build quality, visible gaps in the earbuds, and fragile earbuds that ripped easily ( here are some more specific ones ). These issues forced Samsung to halt sales immediately after the July 2024 release andâ€¦

title: ANBERNICâ€™s next gaming handheld is an unabashed Sony PS Vita clone
summary: Miss your PS Vita? Now's your chance to relive the magic.
body: TL;DR ANBERNIC has announced two new handhelds: The RG VITA and the RG VITA Pro. The design is heavily inspired by the Sony PS Vita, but with Nintendo buttons. This will likely compete with more traditional 16:9 handhelds from Retroid, AYN, and AYANEO. ANBERNIC might have had a slower 2025, but the company has come into 2026 swinging with an announcement for two upcoming handhelds. Unlike the companyâ€™s recent releases, it loses the retro aspect ratio and targets a far more modern design. The ANBERNIC RG VITA and RG VITA Pro are clearly inspired by Sonyâ€™s last true gaming handheld, the PS Vita. They have the same widescreen format, shoulder button cutout, and an all-glass front with connected control bubbles.

The firm has already revealed that the Nothing Phone 4a series is coming later this year, and a leaker has now revealed apparent details. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: T-Mobile crushes Verizon and AT&T to be the fastest carrier in the US
summary: With an average network speed more than twice of Verizon's.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR T-Mobile has emerged as the fastest network in the US in H2 2025. It topped charts, with average peak speeds of 260Mbps overall and 310Mbps on 5G, while Verizon could only achieve 130Mbps. T-Mobile also ranked first in consistency and reliability, as per the report. Ookla, the company behind the iconic Speedtest.net, has released fresh insights about the leading carriers in the US based on their network speeds. According to this report, T-Mobile has emerged as the top service provider for the second half of 2025, with the highest download speeds. It repeats this feat after being established as the fastest carrier in the first half of 2025 as well. This report, according to Ookla, is based on speed tests performed by millions of users across the US. According to Ooklaâ€™s findings, T-Mobileâ€™s average network speed stood at roughly 260Mbps, while its average 5G speed was nearly 310Mbps. Verizon, on the other hand, only recorded an average top speed of about 130Mbps, less than half of T-Mobileâ€™s.

title: Android brands could copy iPhone 17â€™s coolest front camera trick
summary: Leaks suggest OPPO and HUAWEI are testing square sensors that eliminate the need to rotate your phone for group selfies.
body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR OPPO and HUAWEI are reportedly exploring square 1:1 front-facing camera sensors, similar to the 18MP â€œCenter Stageâ€ camera on the iPhone 17 series. The technology could debut on the OPPO Find X10 series and the photography-focused HUAWEI Nova 16 series, scheduled for launch later this year or early next year. A square sensor allows users to take landscape or portrait selfies without physically rotating the phone by cropping into the sensor. One of the most underrated upgrades on the iPhone 17 series is the new 18MP â€œCenter Stageâ€ front camera. While the camera itself is great, the party trick is that it uses a square sensor. This allows users to take selfies in landscape and portrait orientations without physically rotating their phone, as the company crops into the sensor for the shot. Android users could soon join in on the fun, as Android brands have started exploring a square selfie camera for their upcoming phones. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: AT&T and T-Mobile seem to be stronger than ever: Is Verizon in trouble?
summary: Let's be honest: Verizon's reputation isn't great right now. But does that mean it has real reason to worry?
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority A decade ago, if I had told people that T-Mobile would eventually be considered the fastest network in the US and that the brand would become the de facto leader in many ways, Iâ€™m sure I would have had a hard time finding anyone who believed me. Well, at least outside of T-Mobileâ€™s most ardent fans. Yet, here we are at the beginning of 2026, and slowly but surely we seem to be heading in this direction. In 2025, T-Mobile won several awards from major survey companies, including Ookla, and largely became known as the king of network speed . Even AT&T is finally striking harder at the competition , particularly T-Mobile.

title: Google Maps community edits could soon get a major Gemini makeover
summary: A new chatbot-style interface discovered in code suggests users could soon use natural language to update local listings.

The new interface replaces the standard form-like experience with a chatbot-style experience that accepts natural language. Suggested edits are still submitted for Googleâ€™s review before going live. Google has been in overdrive, trying to integrate Gemini and its AI capabilities into all its apps and services. Google Maps has also received its fair share, including the recent Gemini-powered upgrade to walking and cycling navigation . But thereâ€™s more coming, as weâ€™ve now spotted Gemini being added to Google Mapsâ€™ community edit process. title: Nothing could finally make its transparent over-ear headphones affordable
summary: The Nothing Headphone (a) is rumored to launch soon for â‚¬159.
body: Despite their controversial aesthetic, the Nothing Headphones (1) have many handy features under the hood. Credit: Tom Triggs / Android Authority TL;DR The Nothing Headphone (a) is reportedly launching on March 12, with pre-orders starting around March 5. It is rumored to cost â‚¬159 in Europe and Â£149 in the UK, which is roughly half of the Headphone 1. The leak suggests four color options: black, white, pink, and yellow. Nothing is reportedly about to break the premium-only mold it set with the Headphone 1 . After turning heads with its transparent-design over-ears and solid feature set last year, the brand is now said to be readying a more affordable sibling, and the pricing could surprise you. A new report from Dealabs says the launch is set for March 12, 2026, with pre-orders starting around March 5 (via Notebookcheck ). The big news is the expected price: about â‚¬159 in Europe and Â£149 in the UK, which is about half of what the original Headphone 1 cost at launch. This price drop puts Nothing in direct competition with mid-range headphones from brands like JBL and Sony, which is unexpected for a company known for its premium look and pricing.

summary: A new leak reveals all the S26 Ultra S Pen colors, but they differ from previous S pens in a notable way.

The S Pens might only be available in two main colors, but could have different colored tips to match the S26 Ultra colorway. The outlet also posted images of a few Galaxy S26 series accessories. title: YouTube TVâ€™s feud with Disney cost ESPN some serious money
summary: Disney's standoff with YouTube TV was more costly than expected.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR YouTube TV and Disney reached a distribution agreement in November, ending a multi-week blackout of Disney content on the platform. A new report now reveals how big a financial hit Disneyâ€™s sports broadcasting arm suffered due to the blackout. ESPNâ€™s daily revenue loss was over $7 million per day, totaling a loss of over $110 million in operational revenue. Last year, in October, Google announced it was in negotiations with Disney to keep networks like ABC and ESPN on YouTube TV. As the two parties failed to reach an agreement before the then-existing licensing deal expired, a Disney media blackout ensued. Although both corporations were predicted to lose millions during the blackout, the situation wasnâ€™t resolved until mid-November . Now weâ€™re starting to learn just how big a financial impact that blackout had on Disney. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Google admits just how confusing Phone app landscape support has been
summary: Google goes official with a toggle for the Phone app's confounding landscape mode.
body: TL;DR Last year Google started supporting a landscape mode UI for its Phone app. Eventually a new option to lock the app in portrait arrived for beta testers. That setting is now broadly available, as Google addresses confusion surrounding the feature. The software on our phones is constantly being updated, so weâ€™re well aware that the appearance and functionality of apps can change on even a day-to-day basis. But last year, Android users found themselves scratching their heads about one change in particular: Googleâ€™s Phone app adding support for a landscape-style interface . Was it a bug? Was it a feature? Who was even asking for this in the first place? After a few bumpy months, it now looks like weâ€™re finally at the end of this weird saga. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

The database reveals the names and model numbers of the companyâ€™s next tablets and smartwatches. The listings reveal that the next Galaxy Watch Ultra will be called the Galaxy Watch Ultra 2. Although our focus is mainly on the upcoming Galaxy S26 series at the moment, Samsung has plenty of other hardware it plans to launch this year. Outside of phones, that includes the companyâ€™s tablets and smartwatches. These devices have now appeared in the GSMA IMEI database, giving us some new information. title: From multi-purpose tap to high-speed data: NFC exec shares what to look for next
summary: Where's NFC going, and why should you care? An interview with NFC Forum Executive Director Mike McCamon.
body: Pick up any modern smartphone, and you know to expect it to support the familiar cast of wireless standards. Itâ€™s got to have cellular communication, obviously, as well as Wi-Fi. And right after those two, almost certainly Bluetooth and NFC . Seeing new standards like UWB still struggle to find broad support, it feels all the more impressive just how ubiquitous the others have become. Just what do you know about these protocols that find a home in so many of the mobile devices we use? Last month at CES, I sat down with Mike McCamon, Executive Director of the NFC Forum, to pick his brain about where NFC is headed next, and why users like you should be excited about it.

title: The Ring app is now a must-have for all dog owners after this change
summary: If you lose your dog, you can now get your neighbors' smart cameras looking for it.
body: Credit: Amazon TL;DR Ringâ€™s Search Party for Dogs is now available to anyone in the US through the Ring app, even if you donâ€™t own a Ring camera. Nearby Ring cameras can automatically flag dogs that resemble a missing pet and alert users, who can choose whether to share footage with the dogâ€™s owners. The AI-powered feature has already helped reunite more than one lost dog per day since it launched. Losing your dog is often a panic-inducing event, and you immediately want everyone in the neighbourhood on the lookout. While most of your neighbours would probably like to help, theyâ€™re busy with their own lives. Ring is now leaning into that reality by opening up its Search Party for Dogs feature to everyone, whether they own a Ring security camera or not. According to an announcement from the Amazon Newsroom , the AI-powered feature has already helped reunite more than one lost dog a day with their owners since its launch, but it was previously limited to Ring camera owners. With this expansion, anyone can now post a missing dog alert through the app and have nearby Ring cameras hunt for it, even if they donâ€™t have any of the brandâ€™s hardware themselves.
